answers.answer: It is always good with increase in age to go for fusion.If you desire to try conservative methods, you can always try but only if she is willing and she can sustain the pain for longer time.Discuss with any good orthopaedician for further course of action based on her clinical symptoms after examination and also her X-ray and MRI reports.Take care!

question: My 65 year old (type B diabetic) active wife splintered her ankle 25 years ago.  Now she is in major pain due to missing cartilage and arthritis in the joint.  Her doctor says the answer is fusion.On the internet there are options; some for younger people and some for people without diabetes.  There seems to be other possibilites using pig parts, growing your own parts, the S.T.A.R., and others.Is there any easy way to find the right doctor who will perform the right procedure?
